content:
• Tuesday, March 7, 2017
  • EXTR

    Extreme Networks +6.6% on deal to buy Avaya networking for $100M

    • Extreme Networks (NASDAQ:EXTR) is up 6.6% in after-hours trade following an announcement it's entered a deal to pay $100M to acquire the networking business of Avaya, which filed for Chapter 11 in January.
    • That agreement is "consistent with our growth strategy and will broaden Extreme's enterprise solutions capabilities by complementing our product portfolio across our vertical markets," says Extreme CEO Ed Meyercord, who added the business should bring more than $200M in annual revenue along with added market share.
    • Extreme's offer is a stalking-horse bid, and so the company will be entitled to a break-up fee and expense reimbursement if it doesn't prevail in acquiring Avaya's networking assets.
    • Transaction closing (and the auction process) are expected to wrap within 3-4 months.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:51 PM | 2 Comments

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers: MFIN +29.8%. CLNE +7.8%. HRB +7.5%. BIOS +7.5%. EXTR +6.6%.
    • Top losers: HIIQ -13.5%. BOJA -7.6%. EDIT -5.3%. GEO -5.2%. AFI -4.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:38 PM | 27 Comments
  • SHIP

    Seanergy Maritime agrees to early termination of credit facility; shares +21%

    • Seanergy Maritime (NASDAQ:SHIP) +21% AH on news of an agreement with one of its senior lenders for the early termination of a credit facility, which it expects to result in a gain of ~$11.4M, or a ~29% reduction of the outstanding facility.
    • SHIP also expects the agreement to result in an accretion of more than 30% to the total equity of the company on an adjusted basis.
    • SHIP says the applicable credit facility is secured by one of its modern Sungdong Capesize vessels, and may until Sept. 29 satisfy the full amount of the facility by making a prepayment of the outstanding facility amount reduced by ~29%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM | 10 Comments
  • LAND

    Gladstone Land -3.4% on capital raise

    • The company is selling 1.4M shares with underwriter greenshoe of 210K shares.
    • Prospectus
    • LAND -3.4% after hours
     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM | 3 Comments
  • URBN

    Urban Outfitters higher after steady FQ4 numbers

    • Urban Outfitters (NASDAQ:URBN) misses consensus estimates slightly in Q4.
    • Comparable retail segment sales were flat during the quarter.
    • Comparable retail segment sales growth by brand: Urban Outfitters +2.0%, Free People +1.2%, Anthropologie Group -2.9%.
    • Gross margin rate came in 33.0% of sales vs. 33.5% consensus.
    • The company ended the fiscal year with inventory up 3% and square footage up 5%.
    • Previously: Urban Outfitters misses by $0.01, misses on revenue (March 7)
    • URBN +4.72% AH to $26.61.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM
  • HRB

    H&R Block beats by $0.01, beats on revenue

    • H&R Block (NYSE:HRB): FQ3 EPS of -$0.49 beats by $0.01.
    • Revenue of $452M (-4.8% Y/Y) beats by $5.61M.
    • Shares +1.63%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • WIFI

    Boingo Wireless hits record revenues for 2016

    • Boingo Wireless (WIFI +1.7%) reached record full-year revenues in its Q4 earnings and is guiding for heavier losses ahead
    • Revenue rose 16% in the fourth quarter, boosting full-year revenue growth to 14.1%, with strength in both distributed antenna systems and the military segment.
    • The company posted its largest venue acquisition year ever, with 38 new venues and 43 Tier 1 carrier deals.
    • Revenue by segment: DAS, $17.2M (up 48.6%); Military, $11M (up 59.6%); Retail, $6.5M (down 8.7%); Wholesale--WiFi, $6.2M (down 9.3%); Advertising and other, $4M (down 36.3%).
    • For Q1, it's guiding to revenues of $39.5M-$43.5M (vs. consensus for $40M) and EPS of -$0.26 to -$0.18 (vs. expectations for -$0.18). Boingo's also forecasting EBITDA of $8.5M-$11.5M vs. consensus for $9.3M.
    • For the full year, it's forecasting revenue of $180M-$188M (vs. expected $181.4M) and EPS of -$0.74 to -$0.64 (below consensus for -$0.48). EBITDA's forecast at $51M-$56M (vs. expected $51.4M).
    • Conference call to come at 4:30 p.m. ET.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM | 1 Comment
  • AVAV

    AeroVironment beats by $0.25, beats on revenue

    • AeroVironment (NASDAQ:AVAV): FQ3 EPS of -$0.09 beats by $0.25.
    • Revenue of $53.2M (-21.3% Y/Y) beats by $2.54M.
    • Shares +1.7%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM | 1 Comment
  • GEO

    Capital raise for The GEO Group

    • What a difference a few months makes. Its possible existence in question only a few months ago, The GEO Group (NYSE:GEO) - after more than a doubling in the share price since around Labor Day - is offering 6M shares. The underwriter greenshoe is for up to another 900K shares.
    • GEO -2.8% after hours
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM | 14 Comments
  • CLNE

    Clean Energy Fuels beats by $0.07, beats on revenue

    • Clean Energy Fuels (NASDAQ:CLNE): Q4 EPS of -$0.02 beats by $0.07.
    • Revenue of $101.8M (-14.7% Y/Y) beats by $5.33M.
    • Shares +13.6%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM | 23 Comments
  • URBN

    Urban Outfitters misses by $0.01, misses on revenue

    • Urban Outfitters (NASDAQ:URBN): Q4 EPS of $0.55 misses by $0.01.
    • Revenue of $1.03B (+2.0% Y/Y) misses by $10M.
    • Shares +1.89%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM | 2 Comments
  • ESRX

    Express Scripts odd man out in contract with HTA; shares slip 4%

    • Express Scripts (ESRX -3.6%) slumps on an 80% surge in volume on the news that it is excluded from a prescription drug supply contract with the Health Transformation Alliance (HTA), a group that includes six ESRX customers. CVS Health (CVS -0.2%) and UnitedHealth's (UNH -0.3%) Optum appear to be the two approved suppliers under the agreement.
    • Barclay's Eric Percher says the ESRX's maximum revenue loss is less than 1% while Leerink's David Larsen sees a $0.02 haircut to ESRX's EPS and an equivalent $0.02 boost to CVS's .
    • Source: Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM | 2 Comments
  • XTLB

    XTL Biopharma secures $2.8M private capital raise; shares ahead 10%

    • Thinly traded nano cap XTL Biopharmaceuticals (XTLB +10%) perks up on almost a 5x surge in volume, albeit on turnover of only 405K shares, in response to its agreement with existing shareholders for the direct placement of 1.4M American Depository Shares (ADSs) at $2.00 per ADS. For each share bought, investors will receive one 5 1/2-year warrant to purchase one ADS at $2.30. Closing date is March 13.
    • Yesterday's close was $2.01.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:06 PM

  • QGEN

    Qiagen jiggy on conference cancellation rumor; company denies

    • A rumor that Qiagen (NASDAQ:QGEN) had cancelled its appearance at a Barclays conference set for next week stoked the stock earlier in the session.
    • The company has since denied. Shares have fallen back, but are still ahead 1.75% on the session.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM

  • Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2:30 PM

    • Gainers: LGIH +12%. AF +11%. LND +6%. FANH +5%. MLP +5%.
    • Losers: AHP -5%. FNGN -5%. FUNC -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:30 PM | 2 Comments
  • TDG

    TransDigm -3.5% on report DLA evaluating disclosures

    • TransDigm (TDG -3.5%) plunges after a Capitol Forum report says the Defense Logistics Agency is evaluating disclosures from the company's subsidiaries.
    • The report says 12 TDG subsidiaries incorrectly completed their SAM registration by not disclosing that they were owned by another company.
    • The DLA says it is evaluating the report's claim to determine any potential further action.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM | 2 Comments
  • COTY

    Coty names new boss for consumer beauty business

    • Shares of Coty (COTY -1.7%) trade lower along with other beauty stocks.
    • Earlier today, the company replaced the president of its consumer beauty business with a hire from Unilever.
    • Wells Fargo explains its concerns over the announcement.
    • "With the change coming only five months post-closing, it’s a sign to us that the board and CEO Camillo Pane are clearly on the offensive to stabilize and turn around the Consumer Beauty business. However, we remain cautious on COTY shares given weak near-term fundamentals and integration risk in coming quarters," writes analyst Lachky.
    • Shares of Coty are down 32% over the last 52 weeks to trail the returns of Avon Products, Estee Lauder and Revlon by a wide margin.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM

  • Energy/Materials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm

    • Gainers: WFT +13%. UUUU +11%. AMTX +6%. UEC +5%.
    • Losers: SDLP -18%. SDRL -15%. NAK -12%. TELL -8%. AKG -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM
  • ESES

    EcoStim completes recapitalization with Fir Tree Partners

    • Eco-Stim Energy (ESES +23.6%) is higher following news that it sold $22M of its 14% convertible notes due 2018 and 2M common shares to an affiliate of Fir Tree Partners.
    • ESES also issued an additional $19.4M of the convertible notes to Fir Tree Partners as part of a broader recapitalization; the notes are convertible in ESES common stock and would raise the amount of outstanding shares to 44.6M and provide Fir Tree with just shy of two-thirds of ESES stock.
    • Under terms of the agreement, Fir Tree also will have the right to appoint three new members to the ESES board, boosting the number of directors to 10.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:56 PM
  • ASNA

    Post-earnings bump for Ascena Retail Group

    • Shares of Ascena Retail Group (ASNA +2.1%) trade higher after the company's Q4 report showed some improvement.
    • KeyBanc (Overweight, $10 PT) points to the stable trend at Justice and e-commerce strength with the Catherines and Maurices chains.
    • Both CL King (Neutral) and Citi (Sell, $3PT) are less sure about the path for Ascena unless the company sheds stores.
    • Source: Bloomberg
    • Shares of Ascena are down 25% YTD, with the stock consistently being hit on border tax news.
    • Previously: Ascena Retail Group beats by $0.03, revenue in-line (March 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM
  • UNH

    Investors voting early on potential winners/losers under Trump's healthcare plan

    • President Trump's "new and improved" healthcare plan, called the American Care Act (Trumpcare?), will create winners and losers in equities, as always. In a Barron's article, author Johanna Bennett delves into who will be on which side of the aisle.
    • On the plus side, big insurers should be OK, although the number of covered individuals will probably drop, possibly offset by increased corporate coverage since the cost will be lower. Key tickers: (UNH +0.3%)(AET +0.2%)(ANTM +0.6%)(CI +0.6%)(CNC +0.1%)(MOH -0.3%)(HUM +2.7%).
    • On the down side, hospital chains may experience lower revenue growth due to the proposed end to Medicaid expansion in 2020. Key tickers: (THC -5.8%)(HCA -0.7%)(CYH -6.8%).
    • Lerrink's Ana Gupte doesn't think the downside will be too severe, though. "On the downside, Medicaid expansion is [slated] to end in 2020, which is more draconian than expected though the Disproportionate Share Hospital (DSH) repeal should offer an offset for Facilities. We expect this Medicaid expansion funding proposal to be more watered down in negotiations with the Senate with input from the State Governors.
      We remain bullish on Medicare and Commercial MCOs, while seeing the downside on Medicaid Managed Care and Healthcare Facilities as likely to be lessened as the proposal is marked up in Committee and negotiated with the Senate and Republican State Governors, that have expanded Medicaid."
    • Stifel's Thomas Carroll likes UnitedHealth because of the depth and breadth of its offerings, Cigna, once it emerges from the Anthem deal, and Centene because it is poised to benefit from "private sector solution trends" already underway in Medicare/Medicaid.
    • Related tickers: (XLV -0.3%)(VHT -0.3%)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:13 PM | 58 Comments
  • DAL

    Imperial Capital note grounds Delta

    • Delta Air Lines (DAL -1.9%)is one of the leading decliners in the airline sector today after Imperial Capital issues a coolish note.
    • Lower unit revenue projections for the Atlantic and Pacific businesses are a concern to the firm.
    • "Atlantic is estimated to be flat versus down 4 percent previously as a result of capacity reductions, a focus on its partner hubs, and strong outbound demand to Europe offsetting FX and elevated competition,” says analyst Michael Derchin.
    • "In the Pacific, we estimate PRASM to decline 3.5 percent, unchanged from our prior forecast, due to a choppy revenue and capacity environment," he adds.
    • IC maintains an In-Line rating and $52 price target on Delta.
    • Shares of Delta are down 2.48% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:08 PM | 6 Comments
  • HES

    Deepwater drilling at rock bottom, Hess CEO says

    • Hess (HES -2.6%) CEO John Hess says the offshore drilling industry is not investing enough to ensure that it has enough supply growth to keep up with demand growth and offset the annual decline in production.
    • Hess says offshore rig utilization is now at ~50%, offshore drilling dayrates have slumped from $600K to just $200K and barely covering operating expenses, and oil and gas exploration investments globally have shrunk from $100B to $40B currently.
    • On the company’s offshore investments, Hess says while most offshore expense makes little economic sense in the current oil environment there are exceptions, and “we are very fortunate to have one of those exceptions in offshore Guyana," referring to the Liza development, which Hess says offers very attractive returns even at $40/bbl.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM | 4 Comments
  • WMT

    Walmex sales disappoint

    • Walmex (NYSE:WMT) trades lower in Mexico after reporting sales growth below expectations in the nation.
    • Total sales were up 2.9% for the period and comparable sales came in 2.1% higher, compared to 6.2% and 5.3% gains for January, respectively.
    • Consumer spending in Mexico is being closely watched by analysts for signs of weakness amid the trade headlines from D.C.
    • Wal-Mart de Mexico is down 1.50% on the Mexican Bolsa.
    • Walmex press release (.pdf)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: MOSY +50%. NMBL +45%. NTN +24%. MLNK +21%. AUPH +19%. MEET +16%. GLBL +16%. NAKD +15%. LGIH +15%.
    • Losers: AVGR -19%. PERI -18%. OTCPK:RNVA -16%. SDRL -14%. IDT -14%. CVRS -14%. BIOS -13%. SUPN -13%. NOVN -13%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM | 6 Comments

  • Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 pm

    • Gainers: NAKD +13%. CVGW +11%. VNCE +6%.
    • Losers: BDE -11%. THO -8%. CROX -5%
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM
  • ULTA

    Ulta Beauty sized up ahead of earnings

    • Oppenheimer reiterates its Outperform rating on Ulta Beauty (ULTA -1.3%) ahead of the company's earnings report on March 9.
    • The investment firm has a price target of $315 (16% upside) on the retailer.
    • Consensus estimates on Ulta Beauty are for revenue of $1.54B and EPS of $2.13.
    • Recent shopper surveys have indicated continued strong demand for specilaty beauty products, although Ulta's impressive track record has pushed expectations high.
    • Shares of Ulta Beauty are down 2% this week into the report.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM | 4 Comments

  • Bill Barrett upgraded to Buy at Canaccord

    • Bill Barrett is upgraded to Buy from Hold with a $7 price target at Canaccord, seeing strong long-term value in the stock which is off nearly 50% from its 52-week high.
    • The firm likes BBG's solid liquidity position, a strong 2018 growth forecast, and trading at a respective 5.1x and 3.3x estimated 2017 and 2018 EBITDA; for reference, the S&P Oil & Gas E&P Index trades at 7.9x and 6.2x, respectively.
    • BBG's focus is on the Northeast Wattenberg Field in Colorado, where the bulk of the company's DJ Basin position is located, and Cannacord says BBG is having success with its extended-reach lateral program.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • MAR

    Marriott outlines ambitious plans for Europe

    • Marriott International (MAR -0.6%) says it expects to dramatically increase the size of its portfolio in Europe across all segments of the industry.
    • The planned expansion in Europe follows on the acquisition of Starwood Hotels & Resorts Worldwide last year.
    • "2016 was a momentous year for both the company and our continent team.  We added 40,000 rooms in Europe with the Starwood acquisition alone, and achieved our long-term goal to triple in size, from 40,000 open rooms in 2010 to 134,000 open or signed rooms at the end of 2016," says Marriott International Europe exec Amy McPherson.
    • "Now, as we look to the future, we have set ambitious goals for 2020.  We plan to expand our lead in the luxury and full-service segments, to have the largest portfolio in the upscale tier and to win with Millennials in the affordable lifestyle category," she adds.
    • As part of the expansion, Marriott wants to triple the number of signed deals for design brand W Hotels in Europe by 2020.
    • Marriott also aims to lead in the European upscale segment by 2020.
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM | 1 Comment
  • AVGR

    Avinger Q4 miss weighs on shares, down 18%

    • Avinger's (AVGR -18.1%) Q4 revenues increased 64% to $4.7M, including a 118% increase ($3.7M) in disposable devices. Operating loss was almost flat compared to last year. The revenue number, though, missed the consensus of $5.1M.
    • CEO Jeff Soinski says, “We are pleased with the expansion of our installed base which positions us well in advance of our new product offerings, with both a next-gen Pantheris and below-the-knee platform introduction anticipated in 2017. Our R&D team is focused on getting our anticipated new products market-ready, as we prepare to maximize the impact of those launches later in the year. To that end, we are focusing our commercial resources while finalizing our launch plans and forecasts and we anticipate providing financial guidance once we fully update our operating plan.”
     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM
  • TIG

    FDA OKs protocol changes to TiGenix's late-study of Cx601 in Crohn's-related perianal fistulas that shorten timelines; shares ahead 7%

    • The FDA has signed off on protocol changes to a global Phase 3 clinical trial assessing TiGenix NV's (TIG +7.1%) Cx601 for the treatment of Crohn's disease patients with complex perianal fistulas. The agency has agreed that the efficacy and safety data supporting a Biologics License Application (BLA) can be based on 24 weeks' follow-up instead of 52 weeks. Other approved changes include a lower enrollment requirement and a broader target patient population. The changes, which could lead to an earlier U.S. approval, make the trial design more like the European Phase 3 ADMIRE-CD study.
    • The U.S. trial should commence next quarter. The company says it is exploring additional pathways to accelerate the submission and review of its future U.S. marketing application.
    • Cx601 is an adipose-derived allogeneic stem cell suspension.
    • Shares are up on almost triple normal volume, albeit on turnover of only 41K shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM | 2 Comments
  • S

    Sprint testing free Sling TV promotion for unlimited-plan subscribers

    • In a promo-crazy wireless market, Sprint (S -0.4%) looks like it's testing one (in two cities) where unlimited-data subscribers get free access to Sling TV (DISH +4.9%).
    • Customers in Atlanta and Chicago who add four or more lines on Unlimited Freedom will get free Sling Orange service (its least expensive tier) until next May, at which point the price for the streaming service goes to $17/month.
    • The move comes after AT&T began offering DirecTV Now service for $10/month to those signing up for its new "unlimited" data service.
    • Customers with fewer than four lines of the unlimited service are offered a $3/month discount to the Sling TV plans.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM | 60 Comments
  • F

    Ford still positive on European business

    • Ford (F -0.2%) isn't backing away from Europe like Detroit peer GM, according to top execs.
    • "This is still a key market globally for new technology roll-outs like electric cars and automated vehicles, and key for Ford's commercial vehicles," Ford EMEA CEO Jim Farley tells CNBC at the Geneva Motor Show.
    • Farley points to Ford's record profit in Europe last year and close to 4% operating margin.
    • Ford still aims for an operating margin of 6% in Europe even with the Brexit headwind.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:05 AM | 30 Comments

  • Heathcare - Top Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 am

    • Gainers: MBRX +15%. ETRM +15%. PRQR +13%. AUPH +10%. MESO +10%.
    • Losers: AVGR -18%. NOVN -14%. PRTO -14%. OTC:DXTR -12%. AKBA -12%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM
  • WMC

    Western Asset gains after reporting rough quarter; may raise capital

    • After more than 10% of book value vanished in Q4, Western Asset Mortgage (WMC +0.8%) goes on offense, entering an ATM share offering program with JMP Securities for up to $100M of common stock.
    • Proceeds would be used to "opportunistically purchase" targeted mortgage assets.
    • Previously: Book value down big at Western Asset Mortgage in Q4 (March 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM | 4 Comments
  • SIG

    52-week low for Signet as hits keep coming

    • Signet Jewelers (SIG -4.3%) is down sharply after Citi warns that FY17 guidance from the company could fall below consensus estimates (via NotableCalls).
    • Citi lowers its price target on Signet to $66 from $90.
    • Signet was also the subject of a biting piece in The New York Times last Friday. The company was singled out for a relaxed method of computing delinquency rates.
    • Shares of Signet hit a 52-week low of $62.10 earlier today. SA contributor Duane Bair has a warning for investors considering buying into the weakness.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM | 9 Comments
  • FTR

    Frontier Communications -6% as BofA downgrades on risk of dividend cut

    • Frontier Communiations (NYSE:FTR) is sliding, down 6% after BofA/Merrill Lynch downgraded shares to Neutral.
    • The firm slashed its price target on Frontier, to $2.50 from $7.50. Shares are down to $2.60 today.
    • Frontier investors risk experiencing a dividend cut eventually due to revenues falling at a "surprising rate," the firm says. The dividend is well covered now, with a payout ratio of 55% (but rising).
    • The market's starting to price in a cut and so management may proactively reduce the payment, analyst David Barden says.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 AM | 62 Comments
  • WFT

    New CEO increases chance of Halliburton deal for Weatherford, analyst says

    • Weatherford's (WFT +15.8%) hiring (I, II) of former Halliburton (HAL -0.7%) CEO Mark McCollum as its new President and CEO increases the possibility that HAL will acquire WFT down the road, Gabelli analyst Simon Wong says, according to The Fly.com.
    • Viewing McCollum's selection "very favorably," the analyst says he has always believed that HAL is the most logical acquirer of WFT's portfolio of products, and the appointment of McCollum increases the likelihood that HAL eventually will buy WFT.
    • Wong has a Buy rating on WFT shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:10 AM | 17 Comments
  • GCI

    Gannett updates full-year guidance before conference talk

    • Gannett (NYSE:GCI) is off 2% after announcing full-year guidance before a presentation at Deutsche Bank's Media & Telecom conference (set to begin at 10:25 a.m. ET).
    • The company's forecasting revenues of $3.15B-$3.22B (actual 2016 revenues: $3.05B), adjusted EBITDA of $325M-$335M (vs. consensus for $325.3M) and capital expenditures of $65M-$75M, excluding real estate.
    • It also sees depreciation and amortization of about $150M-$155M, and an effective tax rate of 28-32%.
    • “As we evolve the company toward a next-generation, digitally focused model, we anticipate realizing the benefits from our cost transformation projects, including continued synergies related to acquisitions," says CEO Robert Dickey. "While we anticipate more challenging year-over-year comparisons in the first half of this year due to certain strategic investments and the negative impact resulting from the weaker British pound, we expect our cost operational improvements to more meaningfully impact the second half of the year.”
     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM
  • CVGW

    Avocado trends look positive for Calavo Growers

    • Calavo Growers (CVGW +8.7%) pushes higher, despite missing sales and profit expectations with its FQ1 report.
    • Investors may be focused on the guidance from Calavo, which includes an expectation for double-digit revenue, margin and EPS growth in FY17.
    • The company says avocado trends are now working in its favor after a rough first month of the fiscal year.
    • Previously: Calavo Growers misses by $0.10, misses on revenue (March 7)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM | 2 Comments
  • HGG

    Bankruptcy for hhgregg

    • Retailer hhgregg (HGG) files for Chapter 11 bankruptcy in a court in Indiana. The development was widely anticipated.
    • "We have conducted an extensive review of alternatives and believe pursuing a restructuring through Chapter 11 is the best path forward to ensure hhgregg's long-term success," says CEO Robert Riesebeck.
    • Shares of Best Buy are up moderately today. The stock has already been bid up a bit on the expectation that the hhgregg bankruptcy will benefit the retailer
     
     
     
     
    | 10:04 AM | 12 Comments
  • CSOD

    Cornerstone OnDemand downgraded to Neutral at Bank of America Merrill Lynch

    • From Buy, analyst Brad Sills notes slowing growth, attributed to lessening adoption of performance management systems, rather than competition.
    • Further: "Learning management systems [LMS] migration to the cloud remains the key growth driver for Cornerstone. We believe that Cornerstone is likely to win the majority of LMS migrations/displacements, given a best-of-breed offering. LMS replacement plus cross selling of a broad organically built suite (across performance, recruiting, analytics and platform) is likely to sustain 18% to 22% growth (depending on execution). However, with a 1.8% operating margin in 2016 and growing competition from HR platform vendors Workday, Oracle and SAP (albeit slowly building), we believe that it will be challenging for Cornerstone generate meaningful margin at this level of growth."
    • Price target from $48 to $46. Cornerstone OnDemand (NASDAQ:CSOD) $39.89, -3.53%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:41 AM
  • FRC

    First Republic -1.3% after another capital raise

    • The company sold 2.5M shares for expected gross proceeds of $237.5M, suggesting an offering price of $95 each. The underwriters have a greenshoe option for another 375K shares at that price.
    • The hot-handed lender had just raised capital this past November.
    • FRC -1.3% premarket to $95.69.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM
  • MOMO

    Momo +9.6% as explosive live video growth powers Q4 beat

    • Momo (NASDAQ:MOMO) is up 9.6% premarket after Q4 earnings that easily beat expectations as the company continues benefiting from rapid live video growth.
    • Net income rose more than tenfold to $83.8M on revenues that rose more than 500%.
    • Revenue by segment: Live video service, $194.8M (vs. $1M a year ago); Value-added service, $19.1M (up 30.6%); Mobile marketing, $19.7M (up 28.7%); Mobile games, $11.3M (up 45.3%); other, $1.2M (up 61.5%).
    • Monthly active users rose to 81.1M vs. the prior year's 69.8M. Paying users of live video service hit 3.5M.
    • For Q1 it's guiding to revenues of $238M-$243M -- a Y/Y increase of 367-377%. Consensus estimates are for the company to draw $196.5M in revenues in Q1.

  • AF

    Astoria Financial sold to Sterling Bancorp

    • The onetime target of New York Community Bancorp, Astoria Financial (NYSE:AF) will merge with Sterling Bancorp (NYSE:STL) in an all-stock deal valued at about $2.2B.
    • Each Astoria share will be exchanged for 0.875 shares of Sterling, a value of $21.92 each based on yesterday's close - an 18.6% premium for Astoria.
    • The combined company will have $29B in assets, $20B in loans, and $19B in deposits.
    • The deal is expected to be about 12% accretive to Sterling's tangible BVPS at closing, and 9% accretive to EPS in 2018, and 16% in 2019. Cost savings once fully phased in are seen at $100M, or 35% of Astoria's current noninterest expense.
    • Closing is hoped for in Q4.
    • Conference call at 10:30 ET

  • RSLS

    EnteroMedics advancing vBloc obesity treatment; 2016 sales ~$800K; $19M in new capital raised; shares ahead 15% premarket

    • EnteroMedics (ETRM) Q4 results ($M): 0.1 (-4.8%).
    • Net Loss: (4.4) (+34.5%); Loss/Share: (2.65) (+96.0%); Quick Assets: 3.3 (-58.2%).
    • Company raised $19M in January.
    • The company's main product is the Maestro vBloc neurometabolic therapy for the treatment of obesity. It is a pacemaker-like device that delivers vBLOC vagal nerve blocking therapy via electrodes that are surgically implanted subcutaneously in the abdomen. The electrodes are placed in contact with the trunks of the vagus nerves just above the junction between the esophagus and the stomach. The device intermittently blocks vagal nerve signals throughout the patient's waking hours which produces the sensation of fullness.
    • Conference call today at 11:00 am ET.
    • Shares ahead 15% premarket on increased volume.
